column4: Anyone willing to give me a hand getting my new HD to auto mount on boot?
I've been editing my fstab but it's not mounting
give us the fstab listing
dude...  the one fstab line is all I asked for.
oh crap i sure am thanks
have you fixed fstab?  If so, try this and see if it works:  sudo mount -a
df -h
what does it say for / ?
pastebin!
fdisk -l
so you have 2 drives.  sda and sdb.  sda is your 1 TB drive.
add a new line to your fstab:  /dev/sda1   /media/MediaV1 ext3 default 0 0
may i ask why /media and not /mnt? I know ubuntu addes all usb drives and cd\dvd to media, is that the reason?
because it's a force of habit.  Mount it wherever you want.
oh ok. i was just trying to understand.
what did you format the drive with?
what filesystem?
I gave you bad advice.  Change 'default' to 'defaults' in /etc/fstab
that seemed to work not to reboot and see if it holds. Thanks again.
